head.title: World Briefing | Europe: Turkey: Hijacking Ends Peacefully

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Manufacturing, Operations and Logistics

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Europe: Turkey: Hijacking Ends Peacefully

abstract.p: Turkish man, identified as Mehmet Goksin by Anatolian news agency, hijacks domestic airliner en route to Istanbul but surrenders in Ankara; plane's 178 passengers are unhurt (S)

block.p: A man hijacked a domestic airliner en route to Istanbul but surrendered to the authorities shortly after the plane made an emergency landing in Ankara, its 178 passengers unhurt, the authorities said. The man, identified by the Anatolian news agency as Mehmet Goksin, a Turk, boarded the plane with the rest of the passengers in southeastern Diyarbakir. Government forces are fighting Kurdish separatists in the area, and the hijacker was initially suspected of political motives. But he made no clear political demands, after falsely claiming that he was wearing explosives, the authorities said. The arrested man has a criminal record and a troubled family background, they said.

The arrested man has a criminal record and a troubled family background, they said.
